Located in the heart of the hamlet of Goutte d'Or in the former village of La Chapelle, this very beautiful neo-Gothic church, with a recent past shamefully tormented by the constabulary, exudes an ancient and spiritual charm which is reminiscent of the one that Notre-Dame would still have without the plague of over-tourism. Very spacious and very quiet, the area being far from the main traffic routes. It is managed by the Missionaries of Saint-Charles, an Italian order dedicated to helping emigrants.

Small traditional church in one of the most exotic areas of Paris. Little visit to do when waiting for a train. The city of science and industry is not far away, it is worth the detour. Gare de l‚ÄôEst and du Nord less than 10 minutes on foot.
Beautiful church and organ for a very beautiful performance by the musicology choir of the Nancy faculty.
A very beautiful church well located in a quiet location with stained glass windows, statues and heated lights.  A superb venue for a worthy show
Beautiful church which would require a good restoration. Rather cold in winter and very difficult acoustics for concerts. Courteous and pleasant welcome.

One of the picturesque places in the city of Paris. I was very satisfied with my stay at this place. The architecture of this place takes you back into the twists and turns of French civilization in particular and European civilization in general. If you are in the city, don‚Äôt hesitate to take a look. Well known for housing undocumented immigrants

I thank the former father who brought me comfort at the lowest times of my life and allowed me to open my eyes to my life and myself more than I ever had. Parishioner and members of the church you brought me wisdom, a good sense of duty, language and know-how: thanks to universal prayer and it helped me a lot in everyday life. thanks to the Saint BERNARD church infinitelyüíúüíöüíõüß°‚ù§Ô∏èüåàüôèüëåüßûüßö‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüòçüòçüòçüòçüòçüòçüòçüòçü•∞ü§©ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥
Very beautiful church, wonderful place to gather and meditate, even if you are not Christian :)  The space is very large and it has a magnificent organ that I can‚Äôt wait to hear!

This Christian house, located in Chateau Rouge in Petit Banlieue, outside the walls of the tax collectors, is a city church in its form, but it was built in August 1996 by undocumented immigrants called ``Saint Bernard''. This is the site of the "Church Occupation Incident." The background to this is the political shift to the right in the 1990s. Immigration policies have become stricter due to the growth of right-wing and far-right parties, and the number of undocumented residents has increased. While they did not have legal residency status, they were not subject to deportation and were fearful of the police, and at the same time they fell out of the social security net. This is an important facility when considering immigration.

A beautiful Church, a beautiful, very welcoming multicultural community. If you have time this Sunday, take a look. The mass (Nations mass rich in colors and songs other than French) will be presided over by the Archbishop of Paris. At the end of the mass, meals from the five continents will be shared, lovingly prepared by the parishioners. Come and discover this festival.
Beautiful church which would require restoration, nevertheless.
Wonderful church. Open in the afternoon. I consider her to be our lady's little sister. Beautiful stained glass windows. Right in the drop of gold neighborhood. Magnificent architecture.
Beautiful corner of the quartier.
Beautiful, no words to explain such enchantment.

Pretty ornate church in the center of the Goutte d‚Äôor district. This church illustrated the news of the 90s when migrants occupied it to ask for residence permits and decent housing conditions. The media had filmed the intervention of the police and the eviction of personalities.  Nice church in the center of the African district of "LA Goutte d'Or". Famous because a few years ago some migrant occupied the church to protest against their situation.

A beautiful Catholic parish in the heart of the Goutte d'Or district, diverse, joyful and prayerful. A bell tower in mission land, open to a population coming from all walks of life. We are happy in Saint-Denys-du-Saint-Sacrement to have been able, thanks to the success of our annual flea market last year (the JAM 2015), to provide assistance for carrying out rehabilitation work and fitting out the parish halls. , solidarity between two very different neighborhoods, the Marais and the Goutte d‚ÄôOr.
Great church and great group of volunteers: on Saturday and Sunday mornings they distribute breakfast to the refugees. Don‚Äôt hesitate to stop by and give them some food or bread!
Wonderful Christmas concert last night in the illuminated church. Thank you to the parish for opening this beautiful place.
A place where people can calm down and pray, it is worth your visit

Neo-Gothic style church dating from 1860. Made famous in 1996 by the occupation of the premises by families of undocumented immigrants in June and their brutal expulsion by the police and the CRS in August.  Church in the neo-gothic style which dates from 1860. It became famous in 1996 when it was occupied by families of undocumented immigrants in June and when they were brutally removed by the police in August.
It is a Congolese Catholic church, with beautiful songs Sunday prayer times: 3 p.m. to 5 p.m. half of the prayer is in Lingala (original language of Congo) and a little French
If you go there for the choir, run there, they sing very well and it‚Äôs a delight for the ears. If you go there to find yourself in a place of prayer, go to another church

Wonderful architecture. The decor inside is wonderful and touristy. It allowed me to pray well
